item.title: C++ STL
item.description: Binary Search int version while (L < R) { int M = L + (R-L)/2; if (check(M)) { return M; } else if (A[M] < target) { L = M+1; } else { R = M; } } return L; double version while (R - L > 1e-6) { double M = L + (R-L) / 2.0; if (M < target) { L = M; } else { R = M; } } return L; L X X X M X T X R

item.title: HDMI AUX Data
item.description: AVI Info Frame Name Offset Bits Description Packet Type byte[0] - Fixed 0x82 (AVI InfoFrame) Version byte[1] - AVI InfoFrame version (typically 2) Length byte[2] - Payload length (typically 13 bytes) Checksum byte[3] - Header checksum Y (Color Space) byte[4] [6:5] 00: RGB, 01: YCbCr 4:2:2, 10: YCbCr 4:4:4 A (Active Format Info Present) byte[4] [4] 1: Active Format Info is present B (Bar Info) byte[4] [3:2] 00: No bar, 01: Top/Bottom, 10: Left/Right, 11: Both S (Scan Info) byte[4] [1:0] 00: Unknown, 01: Overscan, 10: Underscan C (Colorimetry) byte[5] [7:6] 00: None (BT.

item.title: SwinIR Experiment Summary â€” March 31, 2025
item.description: ğŸ§ª SwinIR Experiment Summary â€” March 31, 2025 1. Environment Setup OS: Ubuntu 24.04.2 LTS (noble) lsb_release -a Python: 3.12.3 python3 --version GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090 Driver: 570.124.06 CUDA: 12.8 nvidia-smi PyTorch: 2.5.1+cu121 CUDA Available: True import torch print(torch.__version__) print(torch.cuda.is_available()) 2. Project Setup Install Python venv and create environment: sudo apt install python3.12-venv python3 -m venv ~/venvs/swinir source ~/venvs/swinir/bin/activate Install PyTorch (CUDA 12.1): pip install torch torchvision --index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu121 Clone SwinIR repo and install dependencies: git clone https://github.
